question.text:
Select the set of incorrect statements from the ones given below.

A. Plasma is straw coloured and viscous in nature.
B. Eosinophils are 2-3% of total WBCs.
C. Lymphocytes are the second-most abundant agranulocytes.
D. Stroke volume is the amount of blood that each ventricle pumps during one minute.

solution.text:
Lymphocytes are the second-most abundant (20-25%) white blood cells (WBCs) and the most abundant agranulocytes in the blood. The most abundant WBCs are the neutrophils (60-65%), which are one of the granulocytes.
During a cardiac cycle, each ventricle pumps out approximately 70 mL of blood. This is called the stroke or beat volume. Each cardiac cycle has a duration of 0.8 seconds.
